info.name: UBIS Provincial Grid API
info.description:
Complete API collection for the Unified Beneficiary Identity System (UBIS) - Provincial Grid

## Overview
This API connects a Provincial Capitol to 20+ Municipalities for social welfare fraud detection.

## Authentication
Uses Laravel Sanctum (Bearer Token Authentication)

## Base URLs
- Development: `http://localhost:8000/api`
- Production: `https://ubis.province.gov.ph/api`

## Key Concepts
- **Provincial Staff**: municipality_id = NULL, can view ALL records
- **Municipal Staff**: municipality_id = SET, can only view their municipality's records
- **Golden Record**: Always search for existing beneficiaries before creating new ones
- **Fraud Detection**: Checks for inter-LGU claims, double-dipping, and high frequency

## Contact
Developer: UBIS Development Team

request.description: Public endpoint to check if the API is running. No authentication required.

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Authenticate and get a Sanctum API token. Use seeded provincial admin credentials.

response.name: Success
response.body:
{
    "message": "Login successful",
    "token": "1|abc123def456ghi789jkl012mno345pqr678stu901",
    "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Provincial Governor",
        "email": "governor@ifugao.gov.ph",
        "role": "SUPER_ADMIN",
        "municipality_id": null,
        "municipality": null,
        "is_active": true,
        "created_at": "2026-01-01T00:00:00Z"
    }
}

response.name: Invalid Credentials

request.description: Revoke current API token.
Get authenticated user profile with municipality info.

item.description: Authentication endpoints for login, logout, and profile retrieval using Laravel Sanctum tokens.

item.name: Beneficiaries

request.description: Paginated list with Spatie QueryBuilder filters. Supports: filter[first_name], filter[last_name], filter[home_municipality_id], filter[gender], filter[barangay], filter[is_active]. Sorts: last_name, first_name, birthdate, created_at. Include: homeMunicipality, claims.
Show single beneficiary. Cross-LGU data masking applies.

    "first_name": "Pedro",

}

request.description: Create beneficiary with Golden Record enforcement. Returns 409 if duplicates found unless skip_duplicate_check is true.
Partial update. Authorization: provincial admin or own municipality admin.
Soft delete. Provincial admin only.

item.description: CRUD operations for beneficiaries with Golden Record enforcement and cross-LGU data masking.

item.name: Municipalities

request.description: List all 11 Ifugao municipalities with beneficiary/claim/user counts. Filters: name, code, status, is_active.
Single municipality with aggregate counts and budget info.
Provincial admin only.
Update municipality details. Provincial admin only.
Delete municipality. Provincial admin only.

item.description: CRUD operations for municipalities (tenants) in the Provincial Grid.

item.name: Users

request.description: Provincial sees all, municipal admin sees own municipality only. Filters: name, email, role, municipality_id, is_active.
Show single user details.
Create a new user. Provincial admin can create for any municipality. Municipal admin can create for own municipality only.
Update user details.
Delete user.

item.description: User management with tenant-scoped visibility. Provincial sees all users, municipal admin sees own municipality only.

item.name: Claims

request.description: Paginated claims with TenantScope auto-filtering. Filters: status, assistance_type, municipality_id, beneficiary_id, is_flagged. Sorts: created_at, amount, status. Includes: beneficiary, municipality, processedBy, disbursementProofs.
Full claim detail with beneficiary, municipality, proofs.

item.description: Claims listing and detail view with tenant-scoped auto-filtering.

item.name: Reference Data

request.description: Returns available assistance types and claim statuses.

response.name: Assistance Types & Statuses

item.description: Reference data endpoints for dropdown values, enums, and system constants.

item.name: Dashboard

request.description: Provincial staff gets all municipalities. Municipal staff gets scoped stats. Includes beneficiary counts, claims by status/type, budget summary.

Returns key performance indicator cards for the dashboard. Provincial staff sees aggregated metrics across all municipalities. Municipal staff sees metrics scoped to their municipality only. Includes total beneficiaries, active claims, total disbursed amount, and flagged claims count.

query.description: Number of recent transactions to return (default: 10)

request.description: Returns the most recent claims/transactions. Provincial staff sees transactions from all municipalities. Municipal staff sees only their municipality's transactions. Useful for monitoring real-time activity and quick access to recent disbursements.

Returns distribution of assistance types (Medical, Cash, Burial, Educational, Food, Disaster Relief) with counts and total amounts. Provincial staff sees distribution across all municipalities. Municipal staff sees their municipality's distribution only. Useful for visualizing assistance type breakdown in pie charts or bar graphs.

Returns time-series data showing disbursement trends over time. Provincial staff sees aggregated velocity across all municipalities. Municipal staff sees their municipality's velocity only. Shows daily/weekly/monthly disbursement rates, average processing time, and velocity trends. Useful for line charts and performance monitoring.

query.description: Filter by alert status: unresolved, resolved, investigating (optional)

request.description: Returns fraud alert summary for the dashboard. Provincial staff sees all fraud alerts across municipalities. Municipal staff sees only alerts related to their municipality. Shows count of unresolved alerts, high-priority cases, and recent fraud detections. Useful for security monitoring and quick access to fraud investigation queue.

The 'Hero Stat' showing total amount saved from blocked/rejected fraud claims. Calculates by summing up all blocked/rejected claims due to double-dipping, proving the system paid for itself. This endpoint provides a powerful metric for demonstrating ROI and system effectiveness to stakeholders. Returns the total monetary amount saved, count of blocked claims, and contextual labels for dashboard display.

response.name: Success Response
response.body:
{
    "total_saved": 2450000.00,
    "blocked_claims_count": 147,
    "label": "Total Fraud Prevented",
    "description": "Amount saved by blocking duplicate and fraudulent claims",
    "formatted_amount": "2,450,000.00",
    "average_blocked_amount": 16666.67,
    "period": "All Time"
}

request.description: Top 5 municipalities with attempted fraud. Shows which municipalities have the highest number of fraud attempts (flagged claims). Provincial staff only - municipal staff will receive 403 Forbidden. This leaderboard helps identify municipalities that may need additional training, stricter controls, or investigation. Each entry includes fraud attempt counts, blocked claim counts, total amounts flagged, and risk status indicators (Critical, Warning, Normal).

request.description: Pie chart data showing percentage breakdown by assistance category (Medical, Burial, Educational, Cash, Food, Disaster Relief, etc.). Helps in budget planning and resource allocation. Example insight: 'Sir, too many people are dying; we need more burial funds.' Provincial staff sees aggregated data across all municipalities. Municipal staff sees their municipality's data only. Returns both claim count percentages and monetary amount percentages for flexible visualization.

item.description: Dashboard summary endpoints with tenant-scoped statistics.

item.name: Reports

query.description: Filter by municipality (Provincial staff only, optional)

request.description:
**Demographic Analysis Report**: Returns statistical breakdown of beneficiaries by age groups, gender, barangay, and municipality.

**Tenant Scope:**
- **Provincial Staff**: Can filter by municipality or view all
- **Municipal Staff**: Automatically scoped to their municipality

**Report Includes:**
- Age distribution (0-17, 18-59, 60+)
- Gender breakdown
- Top barangays by beneficiary count
- Municipality comparison (Provincial only)
- Growth trends over selected period

**Use Cases:**
- Planning targeted assistance programs
- Budget allocation by demographics
- Compliance reporting to national agencies

query.description: Month for the report (1-12, optional - defaults to all months)
Filter by municipality (Provincial staff only, optional)

request.description:
**Monthly Financial Report**: Returns detailed disbursement statistics by month, assistance type, and municipality.

**Tenant Scope:**
- **Provincial Staff**: Can filter by municipality or view provincial aggregates
- **Municipal Staff**: Automatically scoped to their municipality

**Report Includes:**
- Total disbursed amount by month
- Breakdown by assistance type
- Number of beneficiaries served
- Average claim amount
- Budget utilization percentage
- Month-over-month comparison

**Use Cases:**
- Monthly financial reporting
- Budget tracking and forecasting
- Performance monitoring
- Audit trail preparation

query.description: Filter by risk level: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH (optional)
Filter by municipality (Provincial staff only, optional)

request.description:
**Fraud Analysis Report**: Comprehensive fraud detection report showing double-dipping incidents, inter-LGU claims, and high-frequency patterns.

**Tenant Scope:**
- **Provincial Staff**: Can analyze fraud patterns across all municipalities
- **Municipal Staff**: Can only see fraud cases involving their municipality

**Report Includes:**
- Total flagged claims by risk level
- Double-dipping incidents (same assistance type within 30 days)
- Inter-LGU claim patterns
- High-frequency beneficiaries (3 claims in 90 days)
- Resolution status (pending, investigating, resolved)
- Top municipalities with fraud alerts
- Estimated fraud prevention savings

**Use Cases:**
- Fraud investigation and monitoring
- Inter-municipality coordination
- Risk assessment and policy adjustment
- Compliance and audit reporting

query.description: Quarter (1-4, optional - defaults to full year)
Filter by municipality (Provincial staff only, optional)

request.description:
**Budget Tracking Report**: Detailed budget allocation, utilization, and remaining balances by municipality and assistance type.

**Tenant Scope:**
- **Provincial Staff**: Can view all municipalities or filter by specific municipality
- **Municipal Staff**: Automatically scoped to their municipality

**Report Includes:**
- Allocated budget per municipality
- Total disbursed amount
- Remaining budget balance
- Utilization percentage
- Budget consumption rate (burn rate)
- Projected depletion date
- Breakdown by assistance type
- Quarter-over-quarter comparison

**Use Cases:**
- Budget monitoring and control
- Reallocation decisions
- Financial planning and forecasting
- Quarterly financial reporting
- Early warning for budget overruns

item.description:
**Reports Module**: Comprehensive reporting endpoints for analytics, compliance, and decision-making.

**Key Features:**
- Tenant-scoped data access (Provincial vs Municipal)
- Flexible date range filtering
- Export-ready data formats
- Statistical aggregations

**Report Categories:**
1. Demographics - Beneficiary analysis
2. Disbursement - Financial tracking
3. Fraud Detection - Security monitoring
4. Budget - Resource utilization

item.name: Fraud Alerts

request.description:
**Get Fraud Alert Details**: Returns detailed information about a specific fraud alert.

**Tenant Scope:**
- **Provincial Staff**: Can view any fraud alert
- **Municipal Staff**: Can only view alerts related to their municipality

**Response Includes:**
- Alert ID and status (unresolved, investigating, resolved, dismissed)
- Risk level (LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH)
- Alert type (double_dipping, inter_lgu_claims, high_frequency, duplicate_beneficiary)
- Related beneficiary details (with data masking for cross-LGU)
- Related claims across municipalities
- Detection timestamp and criteria
- Assigned investigator (if any)
- Investigation notes and resolution details
- Recommended actions

**Use Cases:**
- Detailed fraud investigation
- Case review and documentation
- Inter-municipality coordination
- Compliance and audit trail

**Assign Fraud Alert to Investigator**: Assigns a fraud alert to a specific user for investigation and tracking.

**Authorization:**
- User must have role: ADMIN or REVIEWER
- Provincial Staff can assign any alert
- Municipal Staff can only assign alerts related to their municipality

**State Transition:**
- unresolved  investigating (auto-set when assigned)
- investigating  investigating (reassignment allowed)
- resolved/dismissed  Error (cannot reassign completed alerts)

**Fields:**
- `assigned_to_user_id` (required): User ID of investigator (must be ADMIN, REVIEWER, or SUPER_ADMIN)
- `priority` (optional): low, medium, high (default: medium)
- `notes` (optional): Assignment instructions or context (max 500 chars)

**Use Cases:**
- Workload distribution among investigators
- Escalation of high-priority fraud cases
- Tracking investigation ownership
- Team coordination and accountability

**Add Investigation Notes**: Appends investigation notes and updates fraud alert status.

**Authorization:**
- Any authenticated user can add notes to assigned alerts
- User must be the assigned investigator, ADMIN, or REVIEWER
- Provincial Staff can add notes to any alert
- Municipal Staff can only add notes to alerts involving their municipality

**Status Updates:**
- `unresolved`  Alert is unassigned/new
- `investigating`  Investigation in progress
- `resolved`  Investigation complete, fraud confirmed/denied
- `dismissed`  False positive, no fraud detected

**Fields:**
- `notes` (required): Investigation findings, actions taken, or observations (10-2000 chars)
- `status` (optional): Update alert status (unresolved, investigating, resolved, dismissed)
- `action_taken` (optional): contacted_beneficiary, contacted_other_municipality, document_verified, claim_rejected, claim_approved, escalated, other

**Use Cases:**
- Documenting investigation progress
- Recording inter-municipality coordination
- Creating audit trail
- Team communication and handoffs
- Resolution documentation

item.description:
**Fraud Alerts Module**: Manage fraud alerts, assign investigators, and track investigation progress.

**Key Features:**
- Detailed fraud alert information
- Investigation assignment and tracking
- Audit trail with timestamped notes
- Status management (unresolved  investigating  resolved/dismissed)
- Inter-municipality coordination

**Alert Types:**
- Double-dipping (same assistance type within 30 days)
- Inter-LGU claims (claims from multiple municipalities)
- High frequency (3 claims in 90 days)
- Duplicate beneficiary patterns

**Workflow:**
1. View fraud alert details
2. Assign to investigator
3. Add investigation notes
4. Update status as investigation progresses
5. Mark as resolved or dismissed

item.name: Intake Module

request.description:
**Golden Record Enforcement**: Searches the entire Provincial Grid for phonetically matching beneficiaries.

**Search Strategy:**
1. Layer 1 (DB): Uses SOUNDEX index on `last_name_phonetic`
2. Layer 2 (PHP): Ranks results using Levenshtein distance

**Use Case:** Before creating a new beneficiary, always check if they already exist to prevent duplicates.

**Fields:**
- `first_name` (required): Max 50 chars
- `last_name` (required): Max 50 chars
- `birthdate` (required): Format YYYY-MM-DD, must be before today
- `assistance_type` (optional): One of: Medical, Cash, Burial, Educational, Food, Disaster Relief

response.name: No Duplicates Found
Duplicates Found

request.description:
**Fraud Detection Engine**: Analyzes risk before processing a claim.

**Risk Flags:**
- **Inter-LGU Claims**: Same person claiming from multiple municipalities
- **Double-Dipping**: Same assistance type within 30 days
- **High Frequency**: 3 claims in 90 days (across ALL municipalities)

**Risk Levels:**
- `LOW`: No risk flags detected
- `MEDIUM`: 1-2 risk flags detected
- `HIGH`: Multiple risk flags or recent double-dipping

**Fields:**
- `first_name` (required): Max 50 chars
- `last_name` (required): Max 50 chars
- `birthdate` (required): Format YYYY-MM-DD
- `assistance_type` (optional): Used to check for same-type claims within 30 days

response.name: Low Risk
response.body:
{
    "is_risky": false,
    "risk_level": "LOW",
    "details": "No risk indicators detected",
    "matching_beneficiaries": [],
    "recent_claims": []
}

response.name: High Risk - Double Dipping

body.raw:
{
    "home_municipality_id": 5,
    "first_name": "Pedro",
    "last_name": "Gonzales",
    "middle_name": "Santos",
    "suffix": "Jr.",
    "birthdate": "1988-11-25",
    "gender": "Male",
    "contact_number": "09171234567",
    "address": "456 Market St, Barangay San Isidro",
    "barangay": "San Isidro",
    "id_type": "National ID",
    "id_number": "1234-5678-9012",
    "municipality_id": 5,
    "assistance_type": "Medical",
    "amount": 5000.00,
    "purpose": "Hospital bills for dengue treatment",
    "notes": "Patient is currently admitted at provincial hospital"
}

request.description:
**Golden Record + Fraud Detection**: Creates a new claim with automatic beneficiary matching and fraud risk assessment.

**Workflow:**
1. Searches for existing beneficiary (phonetic matching)
2. If found: Uses existing record (Golden Record pattern)
3. If not found: Creates new beneficiary
4. Runs fraud detection automatically
5. If risky: Sets `is_flagged=true` and `status=UNDER_REVIEW`
6. If safe: Sets `status=PENDING`
7. Returns claim with risk assessment

**Municipal Staff:** `municipality_id` is auto-filled from their profile
**Provincial Staff:** Must explicitly provide `municipality_id`

**Beneficiary Fields:**
- `home_municipality_id` (required): Where beneficiary resides
- `first_name`, `last_name` (required): Max 50 chars
- `middle_name`, `suffix` (optional)
- `birthdate` (required): YYYY-MM-DD
- `gender` (required): Male, Female, or Other
- `contact_number`, `address`, `barangay` (optional)
- `id_type`, `id_number` (optional)

**Claim Fields:**
- `municipality_id` (required for Provincial, auto for Municipal)
- `assistance_type` (required): Medical, Cash, Burial, Educational, Food, Disaster Relief
- `amount` (required): 0.01 to 999,999.99
- `purpose`, `notes` (optional): Max 1000 chars

response.name: Claim Created - Low Risk
Claim Created - High Risk (Flagged)
Validation Error

request.description:
**Detailed Fraud Analysis**: Generates a comprehensive risk report for a specific beneficiary.

**Includes:**
- Beneficiary details (with data masking for inter-LGU)
- Risk level assessment (LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH)
- Complete claim history across ALL municipalities
- Claim frequency analysis
- Inter-LGU patterns
- Double-dipping incidents

**Use Case:** Before approving a flagged claim, reviewers can view this detailed report to make informed decisions.

**Data Masking:** Sensitive fields are masked if the beneficiary belongs to a different municipality (unless user is Provincial Staff).

response.name: Risk Report - High Risk
Beneficiary Not Found

request.description:
**Review Queue**: Returns all claims flagged for fraud review.

**Filters:**
- Only shows claims with `is_flagged = true`
- Only shows PENDING or UNDER_REVIEW status

**Tenant Scope:**
- **Municipal Staff**: See only flagged claims from their municipality
- **Provincial Staff**: See ALL flagged claims across the grid

**Use Case:** Daily review queue for fraud investigators and claim approvers.

response.name: Flagged Claims List

item.description:
**Intake Module**: Handles beneficiary search, duplicate checking, fraud detection, and claim creation.

**Key Features:**
- Golden Record pattern (avoid duplicate beneficiaries)
- Hybrid search (SOUNDEX + Levenshtein)
- Automatic fraud detection
- Inter-LGU visibility with data masking

**Workflow:**
1. Check for duplicates
2. Assess fraud risk
3. Create claim (auto-detect fraud)
4. Review flagged claims
5. Generate detailed risk reports

item.name: Disbursement Module

request.description:
**Approve a Claim**: Changes status from PENDING/UNDER_REVIEW to APPROVED.

**Authorization:**
- User must have role: ADMIN or REVIEWER
- Municipal Staff can only approve claims from their municipality
- Provincial Staff can approve any claim

**State Transition:**
- PENDING  APPROVED 
- UNDER_REVIEW  APPROVED 
- APPROVED  Error (already approved)
- DISBURSED  Error (cannot change disbursed claims)
- REJECTED  Error (cannot approve rejected claims)

**Side Effects:**
- Sets `approved_at` timestamp
- Sets `processed_by_user_id` to current user
- Appends notes to claim

**Fields:**
- `notes` (optional): Max 500 chars, explains approval reason

response.name: Claim Approved
Unauthorized - Not ADMIN/REVIEWER
Forbidden - Different Municipality

request.description:
**Reject a Claim**: Changes status to REJECTED with mandatory explanation.

**Authorization:**
- User must have role: ADMIN or REVIEWER
- Municipal Staff can only reject claims from their municipality
- Provincial Staff can reject any claim

**State Transition:**
- PENDING  REJECTED 
- UNDER_REVIEW  REJECTED 
- APPROVED  Error (cannot reject after approval, use cancellation workflow)
- DISBURSED  Error (cannot reject after disbursement)
- REJECTED  Error (already rejected)

**Side Effects:**
- Sets `rejected_at` timestamp
- Sets `processed_by_user_id` to current user
- Stores `rejection_reason` for audit trail

**Fields:**
- `rejection_reason` (required): 10-1000 chars, must explain why claim was rejected

response.name: Claim Rejected
Validation Error - Reason Too Short

formdata.description: Photo of beneficiary receiving assistance (required, max 5MB, jpg/png)
Photo of beneficiary's ID (optional, max 5MB, jpg/png)

request.description:
**Final Step - Upload Proof**: Uploads disbursement proof and marks claim as DISBURSED.

**Authorization:**
- Any authenticated user can upload (typically field workers)
- Municipal Staff can only upload for their municipality's claims
- Provincial Staff can upload for any claim

**State Requirement:**
- Claim must be in APPROVED status
- Cannot upload proof for PENDING, UNDER_REVIEW, REJECTED, or CANCELLED claims

**State Transition:**
- APPROVED  DISBURSED 
- All other statuses  Error

**Side Effects:**
- Sets `disbursed_at` timestamp
- Changes status to DISBURSED
- Stores photo URLs, GPS coordinates, device info, IP address
- Updates municipality's `used_budget`

**Fields:**
- `photo` (required): Image file, max 5MB, jpg/jpeg/png
- `signature` (required): Image file, max 2MB, jpg/jpeg/png
- `id_photo` (optional): Image file, max 5MB, jpg/jpeg/png
- `latitude` (optional): -90 to 90
- `longitude` (optional): -180 to 180
- `location_accuracy` (optional): Max 20 chars

**Automatic Capture:**
- `captured_by_user_id` (from auth token)
- `captured_at` (server timestamp)
- `device_info` (from User-Agent header)
- `ip_address` (from request IP)

response.name: Proof Uploaded - Claim Disbursed
Error - Claim Not Approved
Validation Error - Missing Required Files

request.description:
**Audit Trail**: Returns all disbursement proofs for a specific claim.

**Use Cases:**
- Audit verification
- Compliance review
- Dispute resolution

**Tenant Scope:**
- Municipal Staff can only view proofs for their municipality's claims
- Provincial Staff can view all proofs

**Response includes:**
- Photo URLs (publicly accessible via Storage)
- Signature and ID photos
- GPS coordinates with Google Maps link
- Device and IP information
- Capture timestamp and user

response.name: Disbursement Proofs List
No Proofs Found

item.description:
**Disbursement Module**: Handles claim approval, rejection, and proof upload.

**Key Features:**
- Role-based authorization (ADMIN, REVIEWER)
- State machine enforcement
- Audit trail with GPS and device info
- Budget tracking

**Workflow:**
1. Review flagged claims
2. Approve or reject with reason
3. Upload disbursement proof (final step)
4. View audit trail
